content: cap - in the round beginning at the edge of the cap with yarn b and two dpns cast on 18 sts divide all 18 sts evenly over three dpns and with a fourth needle continue to work in the round as follows rnds 1-7 work seven rounds stocking stitch knit every round place a marker to mark the beginning of the round moving the marker for each round round 8 decrease k2tog nine times - 9sts round 9 decrease k3tog three times - 3sts cut yarn thread end through all 3 cap top sts as you slip the stitches off the knitting needles turn the cap inside out as it s the purl-side that you want as the right side slip the cap over the gathered-up nut top fitting the stopper into the opening at the cap before gently pulling the threaded-up yarn around the stopper and working a few stitches to join the cap to the nut i then threaded a yarn ending from the top of the cap into the nut to emerge at the bottom of the nut as a little extra acorn detail - ref fig 5 fig 5 acorn lantern page 8 acorn lantern page 9 nut - knitted flat turn the cap inside out as it s the purl-side that you want as the right side beginning at the top of the nut with yarn a and cast on 6 sts slip the cap over the gathered-up nut top fitting the stopper into the opening at the row 1 increase kfb six times 12sts cap before gently pulling the threaded-up yarn around the stopper joining the back row 2 increase p1 pfb p2 three times pfb p1 16sts seam with mattress stitch and working a few stitches to join the cap to the nut i then row 3-10 beginning with a knit row work eight row stocking stitch threaded a yarn ending from the top of the cap into the nut to emerge at the bottom row 11 decrease k1 k2tog k2 three times k2tog k1 12sts of the nut as a little extra acorn detail - ref fig 5 see acorn lantern pattern page 5 cut yarn thread end through all 12 sts for the nut base pull up to gather then use the tail end to work mattress stitch to join the back seam halfway along add a tiny blob of glue to the bottom of the balloon light -
